meanings.definition: A street in a residential area, typically a narrow one running behind the main thoroughfares.
meanings.sent1: The children played hopscotch on the backstreet.
meanings.sent2: I prefer walking on the backstreet to avoid the noisy traffic.
meanings.sent3: The backstreet cats held a secret meeting behind the houses.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts wandered down the backstreet of memories.
meanings.sent5: The backstreet was lined with colorful houses, creating a picturesque scene.

meanings.definition: A street in a city or town that is away from the main roads and often quiet and peaceful.
meanings.sent1: We took a leisurely stroll down the backstreet after dinner.
meanings.sent2: The backstreet was illuminated by soft streetlights in the evening.
meanings.sent3: The backstreet bakery always smelled of freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent4: In the backstreet of the town, time seemed to slow down.
meanings.sent5: The backstreet was a hidden gem, unknown to many in the bustling city.
